message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of operating a Gaussian Half-Duplex (HD) relay network optimally, which involves information theory (cs.IT) and networking (cs.NI) concepts. The focus is on line networks, which suggests a distributed computing (cs.DC) aspect. The algorithm proposed in the paper leverages similarities between network states in HD and edge coloring in a graph, which could fall under social and information networks (cs.SI) or machine learning (cs.LG) categories.
